–Monarch: Martino II Independence –Constitution ratified: 12 July 1558 Population 10,248,230 (2017 estimate) Currency Jahastian Elagio

Jahastia (Jahastian: Jahascia), officially known as the Kingdom of Jahastia (Jahastian: Ertoscia della Jahascia), is a country located on the Orlastian Peninsula. It has a population of 10,248,230. Its capital and largest city is Amberdino.

Jahastia is a parliamentary constitutional monarchy, which was established following the unification of various city-states on 12 July 1558. Jahastia is a federal state, consisting of five autonomous provinces, further subdivided into counties and districts.

Indigenous people of Jahastia are known as Jahastians, who make up 98% of the population. Various subgroups of Jahastians exist, including Albertinos, Palcines, Restians, and Samatinians. The remaining 2% is made up of people of other nationalities.

The sole official language of Jahastia is Jahastian, a member of the Cavarnian language family. Despite Jahastian being the national language, it's only spoken natively by about 47% of the population. The recognized minority languages of Albertino, Palcine, Restian, and Samatinian make up the remaining 33%.

History[]

Geography[]

Politics[]

Administrative divisions[]

Jahastia is a federal state, consisting of five first-level autonomous provinces. Each province is governed by a democratically-elected governor and appointed cabinet. A 100-member democratically-elected provincial assembly is the law-making body for each province. Each province is able to govern themselves as a quasi-independent state, but must obey the federal government. Provinces are further subdivided into second-level counties and third-level districts. Districts are administrated by a democratically-elected district assembly.

There are thirteen populated places with city status. While most cities simply form their own districts, some cities (such as Amberdino), forms its own county, and is made up of various districts. Cities are governed by a democratically-elected mayor.
